This p=
roblem is because the latest Ubuntu has switched to using dash,
a lightweig=
ht POSIX as its primary shell (i.e. /bin/sh), and shell
scripts often use b=
ash specific constructs, assuming that /bin/sh is
bash. The #!/bin/sh at th=
e top of Heritrix scripts should be changed
to read #!/bin/bash, or alterna=
tely the scripts could have the
bashisms removed.

Here is some more info: =
<https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DashAsBinSh>

best,
Erik Hetzner
